name: November 2022
title: November 2022
body:
Original Confluence URL: https://qbdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/IAM/pages/3723034641 - please cross-check the quality of the ZD article with the Confluence counterpart and remove this line before publishing the ZD article

Table of Contents

    • Okta AD Agent, version 3.13.0
      • Okta RADIUS Server agent, version 2.17.7
        • New permissions for custom admin roles
          • Smart Card authentication
          • New HealthInsight tasks
          • Group rule execution
          • Admin Experience Redesign
          • Event hooks for consent revocation
          • Agentless Desktop Single Sign-on
          • Polling support for Agentless Desktop Single Sign-on and Integrated Windows Authentication sessions
          • Agentless Desktop Single Sign-on authentication progress updates
          • Password expiration settings for Active Directory
          • JIT users from Active Directory
          • Service Principal Name functionality improvement
          • Enhanced Okta LDAP integrations with Universal Directory
          • OpenLDAP support for Auxiliary Object classes
          • New rate limits dashboard filter
          • ISV Portal email address updated
          • Step-up authentication using ACR values is GA in Preview
          • Authenticator enrollment using the /authorize endpoint is EA in Preview
          • Loading page animation feature for the Brands API is in GA
          • API service integrations is Self-Service EA in Preview

See: https://help.okta.com/en-us/Content/Topics/ReleaseNotes/archive/oce-relnotes-2022.htm

Feature

Remark

not in use

not in use

API

Step-up authentication using ACR values is GA in Preview

we should use such things in future; currently no changes needed

Authenticator enrollment using the /authorize endpoint is EA in Preview

irrelevant

Loading page animation feature for the Brands API is in GA

check if activated - should be activated

API service integrations is Self-Service EA in Preview

could replace the iam user in future a cleaner solution; currently no change necessary
